title: Minimum & Maximum Lot Sizes by Zone
summary: Defines minimum and maximum lot sizes for each R-1 zone district.
requirements: R-1 zone: minimum 6,000 sf, maximum varies
R-1(7000) zone: minimum 7,000 sf, maximum varies
R-1(8000) zone: minimum 8,000 sf, maximum varies
R-1(10000) zone: minimum 10,000 sf, maximum varies
R-1(20000) zone: minimum 20,000 sf, maximum varies
notes: Specific maximum values need to be extracted from the table - TODO clarify exact maximum values | LOGIC: Only ONE set of requirements applies based on the specific condition/zone

title: Exceptions to Maximum Lot Size
summary: Lists exceptions where maximum lot size requirements may be waived.
requirements: Exception - Where underlying lot lines must be removed to eliminate non-conformities and results in no net loss of housing
Exception - Where an adjacent substandard lot of less than 25' in width is combined with another lot and results in no net loss of housing
Exception - Where the resultant number of lots increases or stays the same and results in no net loss of housing
notes: LOGIC: Any ONE requirement satisfies this rule

title: Substandard Lot Sizes by Zone
summary: Defines criteria for substandard lots and their size thresholds.
requirements: A substandard lot has width < 50' OR depth < 83' AND area ≤ 83% of minimum lot size
R-1 zone: substandard if ≤ 4,980 sf (typical lot) or ≤ 5,976 sf (flag lot)
R-1(7000) zone: substandard if ≤ 5,810 sf (typical lot) or ≤ 6,972 sf (flag lot)
R-1(8000) zone: substandard if ≤ 6,640 sf (typical lot) or ≤ 7,968 sf (flag lot)
R-1(10000) zone: substandard if ≤ 8,300 sf (typical lot) or ≤ 9,960 sf (flag lot)
R-1(20000) zone: substandard if ≤ 16,600 sf (typical lot) or ≤ 19,920 sf (flag lot)
notes: LOGIC: Only ONE set of requirements applies based on the specific condition/zone

title: Special Regulations for Substandard Lots
summary: Special building restrictions that apply to substandard lots.
requirements: Maximum building height is single-story and 17' instead of 30'
For lots less than 50' wide, the required street-side yard is 10' instead of 16'
For lots less than 95' deep, garage requirements are that it be in the rear half of the lot instead of 75' back from the front lot line
notes: LOGIC: ALL requirements apply IF the specified condition is met

title: Gross vs Net Lot Area
summary: Defines what areas are excluded from gross lot area to establish net lot area.
requirements: Development potential is based on net lot area
Net lot area = gross lot area minus excluded areas
notes: LOGIC: ALL requirements must be satisfied simultaneously

title: Lot Coverage Definition & Maximum Allowable
summary: Defines lot coverage calculation and maximum allowable percentage.
requirements: Maximum allowable lot coverage is 35% of the lot size
Additional 5% coverage is permitted for covered patios, canopies and roof overhangs beyond 4 feet
includes: Footprints of all structures including main residence, covered parking, tool sheds, covered pool equipment units
Projecting elements such as balconies, stairways, porches, patio covers
For roof overhangs or eaves that exceed 4', the portion that is beyond 4'
Swimming pools and spas that exceed 30" above grade
excludes: Uncovered structures less than 30" above grade
notes: To qualify as a structure that is less than 30 inches above grade, a porch or deck may only have open railings above 30 inches—no solid half walls. | LOGIC: ALL requirements must be satisfied simultaneously

title: Gross Floor Area (GFA) Formula & Cap
summary: Defines the GFA calculation and maximum allowable floor area.
requirements: GFA = 45% of first 5,000 sf of lot area + 30% of lot area over 5,000 sf
Main house GFA may not exceed 6,000 sf regardless of lot size
includes: All floors measured to outside of exterior stud walls
Stairwells at all floors and all areas that are greater than 50% enclosed and covered
Covered parking and all accessory buildings which are greater than 120 square feet
Spaces that meet the criteria for second and third floor equivalents
notes: Main house maximum applies regardless of formula result. | LOGIC: ALL requirements must be satisfied simultaneously

title: Roofed 1st Floor Porch Openness Test
summary: Determines whether roofed 1st floor porches count toward GFA based on openness.
requirements: Roofed porches on 1st floor count toward GFA unless at least 50% open
Openness is determined by the perimeter of the porch that is open to the outdoors
If at least 50% open, the porch does NOT count toward GFA
If less than 50% open, the porch counts once toward GFA regardless of height
notes: LOGIC: ALL requirements apply IF the specified condition is met

title: Roofed Entry Features Under 12 Feet
summary: Rules for roofed entry features on 1st floor that are less than 12' high from grade.
requirements: Roofed entry features less than 12' high from grade count once toward GFA regardless of design including openness
notes: LOGIC: ALL requirements must be satisfied simultaneously

title: Vaulted Entry Features Over 12 Feet
summary: Rules for roofed entry features on 1st floor that are 12' or higher from grade.
requirements: Roofed entry features 12' or higher from grade are considered "vaulted entry features"
Count toward GFA based on specific vaulted entry feature rules
notes: TODO - clarify specific counting rules for vaulted entry features | LOGIC: ALL requirements apply IF the specified condition is met

title: Recessed Porches on 1st Floor
summary: Rules for recessed porches on the 1st floor.
requirements: Recessed porches on 1st floor have specific GFA counting rules
notes: TODO - clarify specific counting rules for recessed porches | LOGIC: ALL requirements apply IF the specified condition is met

title: Upper Floor Balconies and Outdoor Areas
summary: Rules for roofed balconies and outdoor areas on upper floors.
requirements: Roofed balconies/outdoor areas on upper floors have specific GFA counting rules
notes: TODO - clarify specific counting rules for upper floor outdoor areas | LOGIC: ALL requirements apply IF the specified condition is met

title: Standard Setbacks by Zone
summary: Defines standard front, rear, and side setback requirements for each R-1 zone district.
requirements: R-1 zone: Front = Contextual or 20', Rear = 20', Interior Side = 6', Street Side = 16'
R-1(7000) zone: Front = Contextual or 20', Rear = 20', Interior Side = 8', Street Side = 16'
R-1(8000) zone: Front = Contextual or 20', Rear = 20', Interior Side = 8', Street Side = 16'
R-1(10000) zone: Front = Contextual or 20', Rear = 20', Interior Side = 8', Street Side = 16'
R-1(20000) zone: Front = Contextual or 20', Rear = 20', Interior Side = 8', Street Side = 16'
Flag lot: Front = 10', Rear = 20', Interior Side = see zone, Street Side = na
Substandard lot: Front = Contextual or 20', Rear = 20', Interior Side = see zone, Street Side = 16'
Substandard corner lot < 50' wide: Front = Contextual or 20', Rear = 20', Interior Side = see zone, Street Side = 10'
notes: For front setback, if contextual setback is greater than 30' then it applies—otherwise, the 20' setback applies. For front & street side setbacks a special setback may apply. | LOGIC: Only ONE set of requirements applies based on the specific condition/zone

title: Contextual Front Setbacks
summary: Rules for when contextual front setbacks apply instead of standard setbacks.
requirements: Contextual setbacks apply if, and only if, the average of the existing setbacks on the same side of the block is 30' or greater
If contextual setback applies and is greater than 30', then it applies instead of the 20' standard setback
If both a contextual and special setback apply, the greater of the two setbacks is required
notes: LOGIC: ALL requirements apply IF the specified condition is met

title: Special Setbacks
summary: Special setback requirements that override standard setbacks for specific streets.
requirements: Special setbacks override standard setbacks unless a larger contextual setback applies
Special setbacks apply to specific streets as listed in Table 3
notes: Special setback distances can be found on pages of the city's zone-map booklet and parcel reports from the city's GIS | LOGIC: ALL requirements apply IF the specified condition is met

title: Setback Considerations for Special Lots
summary: Special setback considerations for easements, sidewalks, oddly shaped lots, and substandard lots.
requirements: Easements - setbacks measured from easement boundaries where applicable
Sidewalks - setbacks measured from property line, not sidewalk edge
Oddly shaped lots - special determination methods apply
Flags and substandard lots - special setback rules apply
notes: Determining where lot lines are on the ground may require a boundary survey | LOGIC: ALL requirements must be satisfied simultaneously

title: Allowable Setback Encroachments - Main Dwelling
summary: Permitted encroachments of main dwelling into required setbacks.
requirements: 1st floor portion at rear of structure ≤ half width of structure may encroach to within 14' of rear lot line
1st floor extension of existing front setback encroachment may extend to within 14' of front lot line
1st floor extension of existing interior-side setback encroachment may extend to within 5' of interior-side lot line
1st floor extension of existing street-side setback encroachment may extend to within 10' of street-side lot line
Attached storage closets ≤ 6' in height & ≤ 25 sf may encroach 4' into front & rear yards & 2' into side yards
notes: LOGIC: Any ONE requirement satisfies this rule

title: Allowable Setback Encroachments - Porches and Entry Features
summary: Permitted encroachments of porches and entry features into required setbacks.
requirements: 1st floor balconies, uncovered porches, stairways, and fire escapes may encroach 6' into front & rear yard & 3' into side yards
1st floor only canopies & patio covers may encroach into rear or side yards
notes: LOGIC: Any ONE requirement satisfies this rule

title: Allowable Setback Encroachments - Other Elements
summary: Permitted encroachments of various building elements into required setbacks.
requirements: Eaves & cornices may encroach 2' into side & 4' into front & rear yards
1st floor bay/greenhouse windows composed of window surface & cantilevered with no floor joists may encroach 2' into front yard & 3' into rear yard
Greenhouse windows only may encroach 2' into side yards
Uncovered parking may be in rear or side yards except for 1st 10' of street side yard
Pools & spas (not equipment) may be to within 6' of rear & interior-side lot lines
Fireplaces ≤ 5' wide may encroach 2' into side yard
notes: LOGIC: Any ONE requirement satisfies this rule

title: Primary Daylight Plane - Side
summary: Defines the primary daylight plane regulations for side yards.
requirements: Primary daylight plane regulates structures located within the buildable area
Structures in rear and/or side yards are regulated by accessory-structure daylight plane
notes: The daylight plane in conjunction with setbacks & height limits creates an invisible tent to contain development and preserve privacy and natural light | LOGIC: ALL requirements must be satisfied simultaneously

title: Detached Accessory Structures - Setback Encroachments
summary: Permitted setback encroachments for detached accessory structures.
requirements: Detached accessory structures that are 75' from front lot line and 20' from street-side lot line may be in rear or side yards
Detached accessory structures for covered parking on lots ≤ 95' deep and 25' from street-side lot line and in rear half of lot may be in rear or side yards
notes: LOGIC: Any ONE requirement satisfies this rule

title: Excavated Features - Setback Encroachments
summary: Permitted setback encroachments for excavated features.
requirements: Lightwells and stairwells may encroach 3' into side yards & 4' into rear yard (cumulative length ≤ 15')
Below grade patios may encroach 2' into side yards & 4' into rear yard (cumulative length ≤ 5')
notes: LOGIC: Any ONE requirement satisfies this rule

title: Parking Space Standards
summary: Defines parking space requirements and dimensions for residential lots.
requirements: Two spaces are required on the lot per dwelling
Parking spaces may NOT be located in the required front yard or first 10 ft of required street side yard
2nd dwelling units have same parking requirements
No underground parking garages except by variance
One of the two spaces must be covered
To be considered detached, a covered-parking structure must be a minimum of 3' from the main dwelling
Minimum size for an uncovered space is 8.5' x 18'
Minimum clearance inside a covered parking structure to be 10' x 20' for each space
Two-car garage or carport to be 20' x 20' clear inside
Minimum vertical clearance: 7'
Clear area for parking space must be free of other uses
excludes: Water heaters, clothes washers or dryer, bicycle parking facilities in parking space clear area
notes: LOGIC: ALL requirements must be satisfied simultaneously

title: Carport Standards
summary: Specific requirements for carport structures.
requirements: Both garages and carports count towards gross floor area
Carports are defined as having two open sides and do not have doors
notes: LOGIC: ALL requirements must be satisfied simultaneously

title: Contextual Garage Placement
summary: Rules for when contextual garage placement requirements apply.
requirements: Contextual garage placement applies if, and only if, there is a predominant neighborhood pattern
If block is more than 600' long, consider only lots within 600' or the 10 lots closest to the subject lot
If subject lot is a corner lot, consider the pattern on the street that the subject garage faces
notes: LOGIC: ALL requirements apply IF the specified condition is met

title: Attached Garages/Carports Site Planning
summary: Site planning requirements for attached garages and carports.
requirements: Attached garages must comply with same setbacks as main dwelling
notes: Uncovered spaces must be located beyond the required front yard and beyond the first 10' of the street-side yard | LOGIC: ALL requirements must be satisfied simultaneously

title: Detached Garages/Carports Site Planning
summary: Site planning requirements for detached garages and carports.
requirements: Detached garages and carports may be located in the rear or interior side yard if at least 75' from the front lot line and at least 20' from the street-side lot line
On lots less than 95' deep, they may be located in rear or interior side yards if placed in rear half of the lot
Garages and carports that take advantage of setback exceptions are subject to a stricter daylight plane
notes: LOGIC: ALL requirements apply IF the specified condition is met

title: Basement Standards
summary: Standards and restrictions for basement construction.
requirements: Basements may not be located in special flood hazard areas
Basements may not extend beyond building footprint
Basements may not encroach into required yards, except where main dwelling is permitted to extend into rear yard
Basements (even habitable ones) do not count as floor area if first floor is no more than 3' above grade
notes: Floor area regulations are intended to address building mass and streetscape appearance | LOGIC: ALL requirements must be satisfied simultaneously

title: Light Well & Stairwell Standards
summary: Standards for light wells and stairwells as excavated features.
requirements: Such features may not be located on the side of the structure that faces the front yard
Maximum width (interior dimension) is 3'
Combined length (interior dimensions) of all excavated features may not exceed 30% of basement perimeter
Allowable encroachment into required side yard is 3' max (however feature must be minimum 3' from side lot line)
Allowable encroachment into required rear yard is 4'
Combined length of all excavated features or portions that encroach into required yards may not exceed 15'
Excavated features shall not be harmful to neighboring trees
Public Works Department must approve drainage system
notes: LOGIC: ALL requirements must be satisfied simultaneously

title: Below-Grade Patio Standards
summary: Standards for below-grade patios as excavated features.
requirements: Such features may not be located on the side of the structure that faces the front yard
Combined area of all such areas not to exceed 2% of the area of the lot or 200 sf, whichever is greater
No single area may exceed 200 sf
Each such area is separated from another by at least 10'
Allowable encroachment into required side yard is 2' max
Allowable encroachment into required rear yard is 4'
excludes: Area devoted to required stairway egress shall not be included in the 200 sf limitation
notes: LOGIC: ALL requirements must be satisfied simultaneously

title: Height Limits by Structure Type
summary: Maximum height limits for different structure types and lot conditions.
requirements: Main dwelling on a standard lot with a roof slope ≥12:12 = 30' max height to roof peak
Main dwelling on a standard lot with a roof slope <12:12 = 33' max height to roof peak
Main dwelling on a substandard or flag lot = 17' max height
Accessory structure in rear or side yard = 12' max height
2nd-dwelling units = 17' max height
notes: Height allowances enable a variety of architectural styles while preserving residential scale and privacy | LOGIC: Only ONE set of requirements applies based on the specific condition/zone

title: Grade Definitions for Height Measurement
summary: Defines different grade measurements used for height calculations.
requirements: For structures on land with natural slope ≤ 10%: use Existing Grade (lowest point of adjacent ground elevation prior to grading or fill)
For structures on land with natural slope > 10%: use Grade (adjacent ground elevation of finished or existing grade, whichever is lower at any point of the structure)
For daylight plane calculations: use Average grade (average of grade at midpoint of building and grade at closest point on abutting site)
notes: LOGIC: Only ONE set of requirements applies based on the specific condition/zone
